src:
Stalne članice Saveta bezbednosti UN različito o rešenju kosovskog pitanja i mandatu Unmika

01 Nov 2019, 08:00

Predstavnici stalnih članica Saveta bezbednosti UN izneli su u Njujorku, na sednici o Kosovu različite stavove o rešenju kosovskog pitanja i potrebi nastavka postojanja Misije UN na Kosovu (Unmik).Dok su diplomate SAD i Velike Britanije pozvale Prištinu i Beograd da otklone prepreke za nastavak dijaloga u cilju normalizacije odnosa, predstavnici Rusije i Kine su ponovili da rešenje treba tražiti na osnovu Rezolucije SB UN 1244 od 10. juna 1999. godine.Predstavnici zapadnih zemalja pohvalili su proces parlamentarnih izbora na Kosovu, održanih 6. oktobra, a kao jedini veći problem naveli zastrašivanje birača u pojedinim zajednicama sa srpskom većinom tokom predizborne kampanje.Predstavnik SAD u UN rekao je da taksa Kosova na uvoz robe iz Srbije pogoršava atmosferu, dok kampanja Srbije za povlačenje priznanja nezavisnosti Kosova podstiče nepotrebne tenzije."Srbija treba da odustane od provokacija i prekine kampanju za povlačenje priznanja Kosova, a Kosovo treba da ukine takse", kazao je predstavnik SAD.Dodao je da "svi znaju šta je potrebno": da Srbija i Kosovo moraju postići sveobuhvatni sporazum o normalizaciji odnosa.Američki diplomata je kazao i da je svaki od ciljeva Rezolucije 1244 ili ostvaren, ili je "postao nebitan", te je "došlo vreme da SB UN to prizna".Naveo je da SAD ponavljaju poziv da se Unmik ili ukine ili reformiše, jer smatraju da misija UN više nije potrebna na Kosovu.Dodao je da SAD "veoma podržavaju" Vladu Kosova u borbi protiv organizovanog kriminala, da izražavaju zabrinutost zbog napada na osoblje UN, ali i da je incident od 28. maja, kada je kosovska policija uhapsila dva pripadnika Unmika, mogao biti izbegnut, da je mandat te misije ranije promenjen.Predstavnik Velike Britanije u UN je izjavio da London poziva "obe strane da otklone prepreke za nastavak dijaloga": da Kosovo ukine takse na uvoz robe iz Srbije, a da Srbija odustane od kampanje za povlačenje priznanja nezavisnosti Kosova.On je kazao da prioriteti nove vlade Kosova treba da budu dijalog s Beogradom i učvršćivanje vladavine prava i bezbednosti.Pozdravio je, kako je rekao, "važan rad" Misije UN na Kosovu (Unmik), a povodom hapšenja dva pripadnika te misije od kosovske policije 28. maja kazao da je važno da se poštuje medjunarodno pravo.Britanski diplomata je ocenio da su izbori na Kosovu 6. oktobra bili mirni i transparentni, ali je dodao da je Velika Britanija zabrinuta zbog izveštaja o zastrašivanju birača tokom predizborne kampanje u nekim zajednicama s većinski srpskim stanovništvom.Predstavnica Francuske u UN je izjavila da je Pariz uveren u evropsku budućnost i Srbije i Kosova, da obe zemlje treba da sprovedu potrebne reforme radi jačanja vladavine prava, ali i da je potpuna normalizacija odnosa Beograda i Prištine neophodan uslov za njihovu evropsku budućnost.Podsetila je da je francuski predsednik Emanuel Makron tokom julske posete Beogradu pozvao dve strane da traže kompromis, i dodala da je prvi korak u tome nastavak dijaloga.Kazala je da Unmik doprinosi stabilnosti i bezbednosti na Kosovu i navela da Francuska "veoma pozdravlja" rad Unmika na približavanju tamošnjih zajednica.Navela je da incident od 28. maja kada su dva pripadnika Unmika uhapšena, "nije prihvatljiv" i da treba primeniti adekvatne mehanizme da se to ne bi ponovilo.Ocenila je da su izbori 6. oktobra bili važni za demokratski život na Kosovu, ali je dodala da je "bilo zastrašivanja u nekim oblastima".Ambasador Rusije pri UN, Vasilij Nebenzja, izjavio je da na Kosovu nema nikakvog poboljšanja bezbednosti ili položaja srpske zajednice."Naša pozicija je jasna: Beograd i Priština treba da dodju do obostrano prihvatljivog rešenja, u skladu s Rezolucijom 1244", naveo je ruski ambasador.On je kazao da EU nije ništa uradila da bi se dijalog Beograda i Prištine nastavio, niti za formiranje Zajednice srpskih opština, ni za ukidanja kosovskih taksi, i izneo da Rusija očekuje da će nova Evropska komisija biti produktivnija.Nebenzja je rekao da napori Kosova za formiranje oružanih snaga predstavljaju "veliko kršenje" Rezolucije 1244 i "pretnju regionalnoj bezbednosti" koju ugrožava i povratak bivših boraca Islamske države s Bliskog istoka na Kosovo.Osudio je hapšenje dva pripadnika Unmika 28. maja, od kojih je jedan ruski državljanin, i ocenio da je kosovska policija u tom slučaju pokazala "potpuno zanemarivanje" normi medjunarodnog prava."Istraga je utvrdila da je naš državljanin, pripadnik Unmika, u potpunosti vršio dužnost u skladu s Rezolucijom 1244, imao je legitimaciju i predstavio se na engleskom. Nije smelo da bude uhapšen, a izvučen je iz kola, udaren u glavu, potom još par puta, a zatim su ga ugurali nazad u njegova kola i nastavili da ga tuku. Imao je potres mozga, višestruke frakture", naveo je ruski ambasador.On je dodao da "sve što je pomenuo" pokazuje da su zahtevi za ukidanje Unmika neosnovani.Predstavnik Kine je izjavio da je Rezolucija 1244 važna osnova za rešenje kosovskog problema.On je kazao da Kina poštuje suverenitet i teritorijalni integritet Srbije i dodao da Priština treba da ukine takse, sprovede Briselski sporazum i omogući nastavak dijaloga.Izrazio je nadu da će se sve strane uzdržati od poteza koji mogu da dovedu do eskalacije situacije.Dodao je da Unmik igra važnu ulogu na Kosovu i izrazio veliku zabrinutost zbog incidenta od 28. maja, navodeći da Misiji UN na Kosovu treba omogućiti da nesmetano obavlja svoju funkciju.Predstavnik Nemačke u UN izjavio je da nova Vlada Kosova treba da bude posvećena nastavku dijaloga s Beogradom i jačanju vladavine prava i pozvao je da ukine takse na robu iz Srbije.On je rekao da kosovske vlasti treba da imaju poštovanja prema Unmiku i da saradjuju s tom misijom, i dodao da je poštovanje medjunarodnog humanitarnog prava nužno.Kazao je da su izbori 6. oktobra bili slobodni i pošteni, i da je jedini problem postojao u oblastima sa srpskom većinom, gde je bilo zastrašivanja kandidata i birača koji nisu za Srpsku listu.On je naveo da zna da ministar spoljnih poslova Srbije Ivica Dačić "voli da putuje na Karibe", ali da novac srpskih poreskih obveznika može bolje da bude potrošen nego na kampanju za povlačenje priznanja Kosova.Dačić: Na ovoj sednici niko nije pozvao druge zemlje da priznaju Kosovo, a to se nikad do sad nije desiloMinistar spoljnih poslova Ivica Dačić izjavio je da je posle sednice Saveta bezbednosti Ujedinjenih nacija (SB UN) da je osnovna poruka tog skupa vezana za izveštaj Unmika o incidentu od 28. maja kada je kosovska policija uhapsila dvojicu službenika misije UN, kao i da se do danas nije desilo da na jednoj sednici SB UN niko ne uputi poziv drugim zemljama da priznaju Kosovo.Kako je jutros saopštilo Ministarstvo spoljnih poslova, Dačić je rekao da je specijalni predstavnik generalnog sekretara UN Zahir Tanin izneo zaključke tog izveštaja.Ti zaključci su, kako je naveo, da su uhapšeni bili na službenoj dužnosti, da nisu prekoračili ovlašćenja, da je došlo do kršenja konvencije o imunitetu i privilegijama osoba koje se nalaze u mirovnim misijama UN-a, da su im nanete teške telesne povrede i da se vode sudski postupci protiv njih."Najvažniji zaključak je da se poziva Priština da kazni sve odgovorne", rekao je Dačić.Na sednici SB UN smo iskoristili priliku da iznesemo sve primere oko kršenja ljudskih prava Srba na KiM, da predočimo laži kojima se Priština služi počev od priče o dekolonizaciji, potom da nisu imali pravo na korišćenje svog jezika i pisma u Srbiji i Jugoslaviji, i na kraju ovaj pokušaj navodnog trovanja članova izborne komisije prilikom prebrojavanja srpskih glasova."Pozvao sam medjunarodnu zajednicu da se izjasni o tome, ali i da se izjasni o stavovima (kandidata za premijera i pobednika kosovskih izbora Aljbina) Kurtija koji govori da će Briselski sporazum biti mrtvo slovo na papiru. Šta to treba da znaci? Zašto smo uopšte pregovarali?", upitao je Dačić.On je ocenio i da je "očigledno da je Srbija veoma ojačala svoju spoljnopolitičku poziciju" i da je "sveukupna politika (Srbije) uticala da se bolje razume situacija oko KiM"."Na ovoj sednici niko nije pozvao druge zemlje da priznaju Kosovo, a to se nikad do sad nije desilo", rekao je šef srpske diplomatije.On je dodao da su se stvari promenile, ali da ne možemo biti zadovoljni situacijom na KiM i da ne možemo biti zadovoljni kako se ispunjavaju sve medjunarodne obaveze koje je Priština preuzela."Zato je potrebno da se o KiM raspravlja na SB UN. Naredna sednica bi trebalo da bude u aprilu sledeće godine", rekao je Dačić.
text:
Permanent members of the UN Security Council differently on resolving the Kosovo issue and UNMIK's mandate

01 Nov 2019, 08:00

Representatives of permanent members of the UN Security Council expressed in New York at a session on Kosovo different views on the resolution of the Kosovo issue and the need to continue the existence of the UN Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK). In order to normalize relations, representatives of Russia and China reiterated that a solution should be sought on the basis of UNSCR 1244 of 10 June 1999.Western Representatives praised the October 6th Kosovo parliamentary election process as the only major problem cited voter intimidation in certain Serb-majority communities during the election campaign.The US representative at the UN said Kosovo's tax on importing goods from Serbia worsens the atmosphere, while Serbia's campaign to withdraw recognition of Kosovo's independence fosters unnecessary tensions. interrupt the campaign to withdraw Kosovo's recognition, and Kosovo should abolish it The US diplomat said that "everyone knows what is needed": that Serbia and Kosovo must reach a comprehensive agreement on normalization of relations.American diplomat also said that each of the goals of Resolution 1244 was either achieved or "became irrelevant ", and" the time has come for the UNSC to acknowledge it. "He said that the US reiterates its call for UNMIK to be either abolished or reformed because they believe the UN mission is no longer needed in Kosovo. He added that the US" strongly supports "the Kosovo government in the fight against organized crime, to express concern about the attack on UN personnel, but also that the incident of 28 May, when Kosovo police arrested two UNMIK members, could have been avoided, that the mission's mandate had been changed earlier. The UN said London urges "both sides to remove obstacles to continued dialogue": Kosovo to abolish taxes on imports of goods from Serbia and Serbia to withdraw from the campaign to withdraw recognition of Kosovo's independence.He said the priorities of the new government e Kosovo should be a dialogue with Belgrade and strengthening the rule of law and security.He praised the "important work" of the UN Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK), and said on May 28 that two members of the mission were arrested by Kosovo police. important to respect international law.The British diplomat said the October 6th elections were peaceful and transparent, but added that the UK was concerned about reports of voter intimidation in some Serb-majority communities. at the UN said that Paris is convinced of the European future of both Serbia and Kosovo, that both countries should implement the necessary reforms to strengthen the rule of law, but also that full normalization of Belgrade-Pristina relations is a necessary condition for their European future. She recalled that French President Emanuel Macron urges two sides to seek compromise during July visit to Belgrade, adding that the first step in this she said that Unmik is contributing to stability and security in Kosovo, and said France "very much welcomes" UNMIK's work to bring communities closer to it. She said the May 28 incident, when two UNMIK members were arrested, was "not acceptable" and should apply adequate mechanisms to prevent this from happening again. She said the October 6th elections were important for democratic life in Kosovo, but added that "there was intimidation in some areas." Russia's ambassador to the UN, Vasily Nebenzya, said that Kosovo has no improvement in the security or position of the Serb community. "Our position is clear: Belgrade and Pristina need to come to a mutually acceptable solution, in accordance with Resolution 1244," the Russian ambassador said.He said the EU did nothing to the dialogue between Belgrade and Pristina continued, neither for the formation of the Union of Serbian Municipalities nor for the abolition of Kosovo taxes, and stated that Russia expects the new European Commission to be more productive. Nebenzja said Kosovo's efforts to form an armed force were a "major violation" of Resolution 1244 and a "threat to regional security" that threatens the return of former Islamic State fighters from the Middle East to Kosovo. He condemned the arrest of two UNMIK members on May 28, of whom one Russian citizen, and assessed that the Kosovo police in that case showed "complete disregard for" the norms of international law. "The investigation found that our citizen, a member of UNMIK, had fully acted in accordance with Resolution 1244, had his identity and presented himself in English. He should not have been arrested and taken out of the car, kicked in the head, then a couple more times, then pushed back into his car and continued to beat him. He had a concussion, multiple fractures, "the Russian ambassador said. He added that" everything he mentioned "shows that demands to repeal UNMIK are unfounded. A Chinese representative stated that Resolution 1244 was an important basis for solving the Kosovo problem. said China respects Serbia's sovereignty and territorial integrity, adding that Pristina should abolish fees, implement the Brussels agreement and allow dialogue to continue.He hoped that all parties would refrain from moves that could escalate the situation.He added that UNMIK would play important role in Kosovo and expressed great concern over the May 28 incident, stating that the UN Mission in Kosovo should be able to perform its function freely.The German representative at the UN said the new Kosovo Government should be committed to continuing dialogue with Belgrade and strengthening its rule He called for the abolition of taxes on goods from Serbia.He said that Kosovo authorities should have respect for UNMIK and cooperate with that mission. He added that the elections on October 6 were free and fair, and that the only problem existed in areas with a Serb majority, where there were intimidation of candidates and voters who were not for the Serb List. He stated that he knew that Serbian Foreign Minister Ivica Dacic "likes to travel to the Caribbean", but that Serbian taxpayers' money can be better spent than the campaign to withdraw Kosovo's recognition. Dacic: No one in this session called on other countries to Foreign Minister Ivica Dacic said after a session of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) that the basic message of the rally was related to the UNMIK incident of May 28 when Kosovo police arrested two UN Mission officials, and it has not happened so far that at one UNSC session, no one has called on other countries to recognize Kosovo.According to We Foreign Minister Dacic said Special Representative of the UN Secretary-General Zahir Tannin made the findings of the report.These findings, he said, had been arrested ex officio, had not exceeded powers, had violated the immunity convention and the privileges of persons on UN peacekeeping missions, who were seriously injured and prosecuted. "The most important conclusion is that Pristina is called upon to punish all those responsible," Dacic said. We took the opportunity of the UN to present all examples of human rights violations against Serbs in Kosovo and Metohija, to present the lies Pristina uses from the story of decolonization, then that they had no right to use their language and script in Serbia and Yugoslavia, and finally this attempt the alleged poisoning of members of the election commission when counting Serb votes. "I called on the international community to speak out and also to declare the views of (Prime Ministerial candidate and Kosovo Albanian election winner Albin) Kurti saying the Brussels agreement would be a dead letter on paper. What does that mean? Why did we negotiate at all? ", Dacic asked. He also said that" it is obvious that Serbia has strengthened its foreign policy position very much "and that" (Serbia's) overall policy has influenced a better understanding of the situation around Kosovo. " no one invited other countries to recognize Kosovo, and that has never happened so far, "said the head of Serbian diplomacy. He added that things had changed, but that we could not be satisfied with the situation in Kosovo and we could not be satisfied how all the international commitments that Pristina has undertaken are being fulfilled. "Therefore, it is necessary for Kosovo to discuss it at the UN Security Council. The next session should be in April next year, "Dacic said.
